bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 153 (Thursday, September 13, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GROTHMAN:H.R. 6812.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1[Page H8727]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

Employee Business Expense Deduction Reinstatement Act of 2018

This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to reinstate the miscellaneous itemized deduction for unreimbursed expenses paid or incurred by an individual in connection with the performance of services as an employee. (Under current law, all miscellaneous itemized deductions are suspended through 2025. Miscellaneous itemized deductions are allowed if they collectively exceed 2% of adjusted gross income.)
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Employee Business Expense Deduction Reinstatement Act of 2018

item.title: Employee Business Expense Deduction Reinstatement Act of 2018
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow unreimbursed employee expenses to be taken into account as miscellaneous itemized deductions.
Employee Business Expense Deduction Reinstatement Act of 2018
Employee Business Expense Deduction Reinstatement Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
